definition: surname Lou/one of the 28 lunar mansions in Chinese astronomy

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to make a mess of sth
to run into difficulties/to cause trouble
to stir up trouble/to bring trouble upon oneself

sentences.english: Musically to break time of tempo is to brown off.
sentences.chinese: 音乐上不合节拍就是出娄子。

sentences.english: And every time they do, the press pounces.
sentences.chinese: 而每次出了娄子，媒体就会添油加醋。

definition: to make a mess of sth
social gaffe or blunder/faux pas/see 出洋相[chu1 yang2 xiang4]
to take a wrong turn/to go wrong
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
lit. if you can't eat it all, you'll have to take it home (idiom)/fig. you'll have to take the consequences
